identificationModule.briefTitle: OverTTuRe: Characteristics, Treatment Patterns and Outcomes of Patients With ATTR Amyloidosis
identificationModule.officialTitle: OverTTuRe: An Observational Multi-Country Study Collecting Real-World Secondary Data on the Characteristics, Treatment Patterns and Outcomes of Patients With ATTR Amyloidosis

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The overall aim of this observational study is to generate real-world evidence on the pre- and post-diagnosis disease journeys, including baseline characteristics, treatment patterns and selected clinical, economic, and humanistic outcomes (for example Health Related Quality of Life (HRQoL), Neuropathy impairment score, activities of daily living (ADL) assessments) in patients with ATTR amyloidosis, and to better understand how the disease is presented.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription:
This retrospective, observational, longitudinal, multi-country cohort study aims to describe characteristics, treatment patterns, and outcomes in ATTR amyloidosis patients.

Primary objectives: Describe patient characteristics (for example demographics, family history of ATTR, key comorbidities and humanistic outcomes (e.g. Health Related Quality of Life (HRQoL), Neuropathy impairment score, activities of daily living (ADL) assessments), treatment patterns, and disease outcomes. Characterize and quantify the healthcare resource utilization (HCRU) in ATTR amyloidosis patients who will be followed post-index until the end of follow-up.

Secondary objectives: Describe demographics, clinical characteristics and HCRU in ATTR amyloidosis patients prior to diagnosis.

armGroups.label: ATTR wild type
armGroups.description: Patients with Transthyretin Amyloidosis wild type

interventions.name: no intervention
interventions.description: not applicable, this is an observational retrospective data analysis study; no interventions in the study

primaryOutcomes.measure: Health Care Resource Utilization (HCRU) - Outpatient visits
primaryOutcomes.description: Annualized events rate for: Overall outpatient visits
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: From diagnosis of ATTR amyloidosis (index date), assessed throughout the study until end of follow-up, up to a maximum of 12 years

primaryOutcomes.measure: Health Care Resource Utilization (HCRU) - Outpatient visits by specialty
primaryOutcomes.description: Annualized events rate for: Overall outpatient visits by specialty
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: From diagnosis of ATTR amyloidosis (index date), assessed throughout the study until end of follow-up, up to a maximum of 12 years

primaryOutcomes.measure: Health Care Resource Utilization (HCRU) - Emergency department visits
primaryOutcomes.description: Annualized events rate for: Emergency department visits
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: From diagnosis of ATTR amyloidosis (index date), assessed throughout the study until end of follow-up, up to a maximum of 12 years

primaryOutcomes.measure: Health Care Resource Utilization (HCRU) - Hospitalizations, length of stay
primaryOutcomes.description: Annualized events rate for: Hospitalizations (bed days)
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: From diagnosis of ATTR amyloidosis (index date), assessed throughout the study until end of follow-up, up to a maximum of 12 years

primaryOutcomes.description: Annualized events rate for: Hospitalizations Overlaps (e.g., hospitalization after emergency department visit) are allowed and counted as separate visits
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: From diagnosis of ATTR amyloidosis (index date), assessed throughout the study until end of follow-up, up to a maximum of 12 years

primaryOutcomes.measure: Health Care Resource Utilization (HCRU) - Health care cost
primaryOutcomes.description: This variable will describe all-cause direct medical and pharmacy costs only, utilizing the amount charged, where available in the data. The direct medical costs will include costs incurred from inpatient stays, outpatient visits, emergency room visits, procedures, and laboratory tests. The inclusion of pharmacy costs is subject to data availability and will include all pharmacy costs per patient separated on pharmacy dispensed and in-hospital dispensed when possible. When feasible, costs will be divided on all-cause, CV, and other specialties
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: From diagnosis of ATTR amyloidosis (index date), assessed throughout the study until end of follow-up, up to a maximum of 12 years
From diagnosis of ATTR amyloidosis (index date) until date of first cardiac transplant, assessed throughout the study until end of follow-up, up to a maximum of 12 years
From diagnosis of ATTR amyloidosis (index date) until date of death due to any cause, assessed throughout the study until end of follow-up, up to a maximum of 12 years
From diagnosis of ATTR amyloidosis (index date) until date of first liver transplant, assessed throughout the study until end of follow-up, up to a maximum of 12 years
From diagnosis of ATTR amyloidosis (index date) until date of first hospitalization for heart failure, assessed throughout the study until end of follow-up, up to a maximum of 12 years

primaryOutcomes.description: New amyloidosis manifestation (time-to-event); Time to the first development of a new clinical manifestation that the patient did not have pre-index)
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: From diagnosis of ATTR amyloidosis (index date) until date of first diagnosis of new ATTR amyloidosis clinical manifestation, assessed throughout the study until end of follow-up, up to a maximum of 12 years
From diagnosis of ATTR amyloidosis (index date) until date of first hospitalization for any reason, assessed throughout the study until end of follow-up, up to a maximum of 12 years

primaryOutcomes.description: The NIS Score has a range of 0 to 244 and a higher NIS score indicates poorer function
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: From diagnosis of ATTR amyloidosis (index date), assessed throughout the study until end of follow-up, up to a maximum of 12 years

primaryOutcomes.description: The NIS-LL score has a range of 0-88 and a greater NIS-LL score indicates poorer function
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: From diagnosis of ATTR amyloidosis (index date), assessed throughout the study until end of follow-up, up to a maximum of 12 years

primaryOutcomes.description: The NIS+7 Score has a range of -26.04 to 270.04 and a higher NIS+7 score indicates poorer function
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: From diagnosis of ATTR amyloidosis (index date), assessed throughout the study until end of follow-up, up to a maximum of 12 years

primaryOutcomes.description: The mNIS+7 Score has a range of -22.32 to 102.32 and a higher mNIS+7 score indicates poorer function
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: From diagnosis of ATTR amyloidosis (index date), assessed throughout the study until end of follow-up, up to a maximum of 12 years

primaryOutcomes.description: NSC score is a questionnaire composed of 38 questions that assess the presence and severity of these neuropathy symptoms. The NSC score ranges from -114 to 114 for males and -108 to 108 for females. Greater scores indicate worse symptom severity; a negative value indicates an improvement in symptom severity from baseline
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: From diagnosis of ATTR amyloidosis (index date), assessed throughout the study until end of follow-up, up to a maximum of 12 years

primaryOutcomes.description: The PND is a 6-stage scoring system: Stage 0: no impairment; Stage 1: sensory disturbances but preserved walking capabilities; Stage 2: impaired walking capacity, but ability to walk without a stick or crutches; Stage 3A/B: walking with help of 1 or 2 sticks or crutches; Stage 4: confined to wheel chair or bedridden. A greater stage indicates greater impairment
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: From diagnosis of ATTR amyloidosis (index date), assessed throughout the study until end of follow-up, up to a maximum of 12 years

primaryOutcomes.measure: Other relevant clinical measurement of ATTR amyloidosis functional status
primaryOutcomes.description: Any other relevant clinical measurement of ATTR amyloidosis functional status
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: From diagnosis of ATTR amyloidosis (index date), assessed throughout the study until end of follow-up, up to a maximum of 12 years

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Patients aged \>18 years at study index date AND
* A reported diagnosis code for amyloidosis OR
* A claim for ATTR-specific treatment OR
* A positive biopsy for amyloidosis and positive immunostaining result of biopsy for ATTR

Exclusion Criteria:

* Evidence of primary (AL) and secondary (AA) amyloidosis AND/OR
* At least one claim/procedure code for stem cell transplant or at least two claims/procedure codes for chemotherapy and autoimmune disease drugs which may represent AL (primary) or AA (secondary) amyloidosis treatments
eligibilityModule.studyPopulation: This study will include data from patients aged \> 18 years with a diagnosis of ATTR amyloidosis or other evidence confirming ATTR amyloidosis. Patients will be followed until exit from the database (loss to follow-up), death, or end of database period (data collection). Baseline data will apply a lookback period of 12 months. Patient identification will be from 2014-01-01 onwards
